intro: Popowia cambodica, commonly known as the Cambodian popowia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Popowia cambodica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
